title: Tokyo - Asakusa, Imperial Palace
content:
For the last day, I was happy to do quiet things not too far away. Tristan had suggested a place to grab melon bread in Asakusa, so I headed there first.

The melon bread was delicious! Freshly baked and very popular, it was the perfect blend of crispy outside and fluffy light inside.

From here I continued to Senso-ji, scoping out restaurants along the way. After a bit of a look around, I picked a restaurant with a nice looking teriyaki chicken lunch set - this was a fantastic last meal to round out the trip.

After lunch I went to the Imperial Palace grounds for a look - they were setting up a lot of tents and things, I think in preparation for the emporer's birthday event, so the views weren't as impressive, though it was neat to see just how much setup was going on.

I spent the rest of the afternoon having some snacks in Ueno park, reflecting on the trip and enjoying some down time.

When it was time to leave, I picked up my luggage from the hotel and caught the Skyliner direct to the airport. 

And with that, the trip was pretty much over. It was a different sort of a trip, but spending time with Tristan and his family was excellent ðŸ™‚
